title: An In-Depth Examination of Requirements for Disclosure Risk Assessment. (arXiv:2310.09398v1 [cs.CR])
abstract: The use of formal privacy to protect the confidentiality of responses in the 2020 Decennial Census of Population and Housing has triggered renewed interest and debate over how to measure the disclosure risks and societal benefits of the published data products. Following long-established precedent in economics and statistics, we argue that any proposal for quantifying disclosure risk should be based on pre-specified, objective criteria. Such criteria should be used to compare methodologies to identify those with the most desirable properties. We illustrate this approach, using simple desiderata, to evaluate the absolute disclosure risk framework, the counterfactual framework underlying differential privacy, and prior-to-posterior comparisons. translated_title: 对披露风险评估需求的深入探讨
translated_abstract: 在2020年人口普查中，使用正式的隐私保护措施保护回答的机密性，引发了如何衡量发布的数据产品的披露风险和社会利益的新一轮兴趣和辩论。我们认为，根据经济学和统计学的长期惯例，任何量化披露风险的提议都应基于预先指定的客观准则。这些准则应用于比较不同的方法论，以确定具有最理想特性的方法。我们使用简单的需求指导法来说明这种方法，评估绝对披露风险框架、基于反事实的差分隐私框架以及先验与后验比较。我们得出结论，满足所有需求指导是不可能的，但基于反事实的比较满足最多的需求，而绝对披露风险满足的需求最少。此外，我们解释了针对差分隐私的许多批评观点。
tldr: 该论文讨论了评估披露风险的需求，并提出了基于预先指定的客观准则进行比较的方法。研究发现，基于反事实的比较满足最多的需求，而绝对披露风险满足的需求最少。
en_tdlr: This paper discusses the requirements for assessing disclosure risk and proposes a method for comparing different approaches based on pre-specified objective criteria. The study finds that counterfactual comparisons satisfy the most requirements, while absolute disclosure risk satisfies the fewest.
